DataElement.preferredName: Observation Performed Study Activity Information Source Type Code Sentinel CDM Cause of Death Source
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._Where something is available or from where it originates._A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities._Source of cause of death information.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sentinel CDM Cause of Death Source
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Source of cause of death information.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A centralized database of death record information established as a resource to aid epidemiologists and other health and medical investigators with mortality ascertainment activities.

Concepts.definition: A centralized database of death record information established as a resource to aid epidemiologists and other health and medical investigators with mortality ascertainment activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A constituent administrative district of a nation.: The cessation of life.: A set of related records (either written or electronic) kept together.

Concepts.definition: A constituent administrative district of a nation.
A set of related records (either written or electronic) kept together.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

Concepts.definition: Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueDomain.origin: Sentinel CDM:The Sentinel Common Data Model

DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.1 and Sentinel value set for CDM.
